questions.question_text: Which choice represents the three best ways of extending Discovery?
What is the recommended method for excluding specific software from discovery on Windows and Unix Servers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-operations-management/page/product/discovery/concept/c_DiscoveryConfigurationConsole.html
You can filter the discovery of software packages based on the keywords they contain for Windows and UNIX computers.

choices.C: Each cell is a CI attribute
choices.D: Each cell is a scalar variable

discussion.content:
D is correct 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-operations-management/page/product/service-mapping/reference/r_PatternVariables.html

A variable can be:
Scalar: A single string
Tabular: A table, where each cell is a scalar variable.
Vector: A single, unnamed column with as many rows as needed

questions.question_text: Which of the choices best describes a tabular variable in a discovery pattern?
When configuring the MID Server Service Settings, which of the following is not a valid MID Server name?

discussion.content:
C is correct
https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0744416

MID Server naming
The MID server name cannot start with "mid.server"

If it does, the the problem with inserting ECC records in the ECC queue fails to insert properly.

This is because the agent field in the ECC queue will append "mid.server" to the beginning of the MID server name. This causes the records in the ecc queue to be incorrect and fails to send commands to the MID server.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is not used in a horizontal discovery pattern?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I want to again correct my first answer. I think the correct answer is actually conectivity section. When you go to the pattern and select Infrastructure as the type, it shows two sections the "Identification section" and the "extension section". When you select application, it show both of those as well as a "Connection Section" not "Connectivity" I think this is a trick question.

B is correct. 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-operations-management/page/product/service-mapping/task/t_DefineConnecSectionPatDef.html

Procedure

Navigate to All > Pattern Designer > Discovery Patterns and open the required pattern from the pattern list.
The pattern must be of the Application type.

In the Connectivity Section, click New.
Note: The Connectivity Section is greyed out if the pattern cannot be edited for Service Mapping.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D.
